name: Flow Payments
author: Swell Finance

sections.description:
Flow Payments is an e-commerce solution. Utilising Stripe.js, Flow Payments makes it quick and easy to setup a fully functioning shop online, in an existing WordPress site. Simply register at http://swell.finance and connect to stripe. Copy your keys into the plugin and create a shop page.

Then you can create products, control stock levels, customise your payment form to collect your customers data and much more.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

e.g.

  1. Upload flow-payments.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Place <?php do_action('flow_payments'); ?> in your templates
  4. Head over to http://swell.finance and register an account.
  5. Connect your account to Stripe, fill out the form and you will be show two keys.
  6. Copy the keys into the settings tab of your plugin.
  7. You’re good to go!
sections.faq:
How much does Flow Payments cost?

Flow Payments is free to download and set up. We charge a transaction fee of 2.9% on all UK card transactions. In the future we’re aiming to reduce this fee for ecologically sound companies.

What do I do if I want a new feature or find a bug?

Since we’re rolling our first release out, there may be some bugs or you may need some functionality.
We’re really keen to hear all your thoughts, just drop an email to support@bigandi.co
sections.changelog:
1.1.0

Currency selection added, with database changes. Now populating the app and admin area with selected currencies.

1.0.2

Fixed the start up script for the payment form.

1.0.1

Updated the checkout form styles, so they don’t get overridden by other themes. Let us know if you see any others.

1.0.0

Released.
